PAGE.TITLE: The matrix inverse
PAGE.DESCRIPTION:
The inverse of a square matrix $\mathbf{A}$ (if it exists) is the matrix $\mathbf{A}^{-1}$ which satisfies:
$$
\mathbf{A}^{-1}\mathbf{A}=\mathbf{A} \mathbf{A}^{-1}=\mathbf{I}
$$
where $\mathbf{I}$ is the unit matrix:
$$
\mathbf{I} =
\left(
\begin{matrix}
1 & 0 & \cdots & 0 \\
0 & 1 & \cdots & 0 \\
\vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
0 & 0 & \cdots & 1 \\
\end{matrix}
\right)
$$

UL.LI: You should be able to invert $2x2$ and $3x3$ matrices using pen and paper.
You should be able write python programs that use libraries to calculate the inverse of a square matrix
You should be able to explain how the matrix inverse is used to solve systems of linear equations.
